fields.art_header_en: Bélo received in 2006 the French "RFI" award. Since then, this self-taught performer is a symbol of the Haitian music renewal movement. His style is a blend of different kinds of Caribbean musics, with a certain tad of reggae. His self-penned songs reveal that  Bélo is also a song writer.
fields.art_header_fr: Découvert en 2006, au moment où il a gagné le prix RFI, Bélo est l'un des nouveaux espoirs de la chanson haïtienne. Totalement autodidacte, son style panache subtilement les différents styles musicaux des Caraïbes,  avec un penchant avoué pour le reggae, mais s'appuie surtout sur des qualités d'écriture incontestables.

fields.art_header_en: Abed Azrié was born in Aleppo, Syria, at the meeting point of many musical traditions; between east and west, Aleppo is at the doorway to what was once Mesopotamia, one of the cradles of civilization. While travelling, Abed discovered Paris. He has been living there since 1967. Abed Azrié puts an avant-garde twist on his songs, and thus is able to revive such legends as the Epic of Gilgamesh, Sufi poetry, classic Arab poetry as well as Andalucian songs.
fields.art_header: Abed Azrie 's voice contain all the sunshine of the riviera, from Syria (his homeland) to France. With his poetic world, somewhere between Mesopotamia and Europe, between tradition and modernity, Abed Azrié proves that the world is eternaly young !
fields.art_biography_fr: Né à Alep (Syrie), Abed Azrié a été placé au confluent de nombreuses cultures musicales : entre Orient et Occident, Alep est la porte du Levant et de la Mésopotamie, berceau des cultures méditerranéennes auprès duquel veillent les influences grecques, turques, iraniennes et arméniennes.  Adolescent, entre les villes d'Alep et de Beyrouth, il rencontre les musiques populaires occidentales et étudie la littérature arabe à l'Université libanaise. Au cours d'un voyage, il découvre Paris. Il y vit et travaille depuis 1967. Toujours attentif aux compositions les plus avant-gardistes, il a su ressusciter la légende sumérienne de Gilgamesh, revivifier les poètes soufis, interpréter et diffuser les plus grands poètes arabes classiques et contemporains ainsi que les auteurs andalous.  Aujourd'hui, il croit à l'art comme ferment humaniste. En exhumant à travers des textures musicales contemporaines les traditions orales et écrites, Abed Azrié se veut avant tout un homme de liberté.
fields.art_header_fr: Né à Alep (Syrie), Abed Azrié a été placé au confluent de nombreuses cultures musicales : entre Orient et Occident, Alep est la porte du Levant et de la Mésopotamie, berceau des cultures méditerranéennes auprès duquel veillent les influences grecques, turques, iraniennes et arméniennes. Au cours d’un voyage, il découvre Paris. Il y vit et travaille depuis 1967. Toujours attentif aux compositions les plus avant-gardistes, il a su ressusciter la légende sumérienne de Gilgamesh, revivifier les poètes soufis, interpréter et diffuser les plus grands poètes arabes classiques et contemporains ainsi que les Andalous.
fields.art_keywords: abed azrie, middle east, syria,  pour enfants seulement, france, europe

fields.art_header_en: Fally Ipupa, AKA Di Caprio, is a star of the Congolese music scene. He started out playing in many groups in Kinshasa when he was discovered by Koffi Olomide. His first full-length album, Droit Chemin, was released in 2006.
fields.art_header_fr: Fally Ipupa, alias"Di Caprio", est une star de la scène musicale congolaise. Il a commencé par jouer dans plusieurs groupes à Kinshasa avant d'être repéré par Koffi Olomide.

fields.art_header_en: Antonie Ciosi is simply one the most renowned Corsican singers. With 40 albums, a 40 years-long career and numerous concerts, Antoine Ciosi is a living legend.
fields.art_header: Antonie Ciosi is simply the most renowned and Corsican singer. With 40 albums, a 50 years long carrier and numerous worldwide tours, Antoine Ciosi is a living legend.
fields.art_biography_fr:
Naître dans l'entre-deux guerres en Castagniccia,à Sorbu Ocagnanu,place du théâtre,a influencé le destin d'Antoine Ciosi .Il a entendu dès son plus jeune âge les troubadours,les baladins ,les montreurs d'our, devant la maison paternelle .
Antoine Ciosi aime à rappeler que sa grande chance fut de naître en Corse, au milieu de villageois: "Ces racines ont donné un sens à ma vie". Ce patrimoine culturel reçu en héritage,riche de tant de siècles d'une histoire tumultueuse,est pour lui une source profonde et inépuisable d'inspiration.
C'est au siège de la Sacem à Paris que Antoine Ciosi, le créateur de « Paese spentu » (Prix de la chanson corse en 1961) et du « Tragulinu », a reçu récemment au cours d'une cérémonie solennelle les insignes de chevalier de la Légion d'honneur des mains du président Jacques Demarny, par ailleurs parolier de nombreuses chansons à succès.
fields.art_notes: Création page mondomix le 15/06/2006Création page mondomix le 15/06/2006
fields.art_biography:
Corsican music giant Antoine Ciosi celebrates its 50 years of career with this new album. The Mediterranean crooner meets the new generation of Corsican artists including Patrizia Gattaceca (Nouvelles Polyphonies Corses and Soledonna singer), Barbara Fortuna (the new polyphonic sensation) and Spanish singer Josefina.
The album is produced by Jean-Bernard Rongiconi, former I Muvrini guitarist and producer, and features brand new songs written by Jean-Paul Poletti, Feli and other great Corsican songwriters.
fields.art_header_fr: Grand retour du géant de la chanson corse ... 40 ans de carrière, 40 albums, des tournées dans le monde  entier et plusieurs triomphes à l'Olympia, à Mogador, à Chaillot ...  Antoine Ciosi est tout simplement l'un des chanteurs corses les plus renommés.
fields.art_biography_en: Antoine Ciosi was born between the two world wars in Castagniccia, in Sorbu Ocagnanu. He heard early the troubadours and the street artists in front of the paternal house, situated on the theatre place. Antoine Ciosi likes to recall that its great chance was to be born in Corsica, among villagers: "These roots gave a direction to my life". This cultural inheritance received in heritage, full of bustling stories, is for him a major and endless source of inspiration.  In Paris,  Antoine Ciosi, the creator of "Paese spentu" (Price of the Corsican song in 1961) and of  "Tragulinu", recently received during a solemn ceremony the badges of chevalier of the Legion of Honour from the hands of president Jacques Demarny, lyric writer of many songs.
fields.art_keywords: antoine ciosi, france, corse, polyphonies corses, josefina, feli, jean-paul poletti, luisa

fields.art_header_en: The composer and musician Phillip Peris was born in the mid-60s. He plays the didgeridoo, which he took up during a stay in the desert area in Central Australia. Since 1988, he has been travelling all over Europe, presenting his culture and the ancestral didgeridoo.
fields.art_header_fr: Compositeur et musicien, Phillip Peris est né au milieu des années 60. Il a débuté l'étude de son instrument, le didgeridoo, en Autralie. Depuis 1988, il voyage à travers l'Europe afin de faire connaître sa culture et l'ancestral didgeridoo.

fields.art_header_en: Samba grew up in Dabi, a small village close to Tombouctou. His mother was very close to Ali Farka Toure, having even sung several songs with him. It was therefore natural that Samba took after the famous guitarist. After having learned the basics, he received the opportunity to accompany Ali Farka Toure's band for his international tour in 1997. By the end of it, Samba had associated with Zoumana Tereta, the master of sokou (a Malian violin), his brother Bouri, and Djimé Sissoko (the brother of Baba Sissoko) and together they brought to surface their own Malian blues.
fields.art_header_fr: Samba a grandi à Dabi, un petit village proche de Tombouctou. Sa mère était proche d'Ali Farka Toure. Elle avait même chanté avec lui. C'est donc tout naturellement que Samba a pris modèle sur le célèbre guitariste. Après avoir appris les rudiments du métier dans des formationss comme Farafina Lolo ou Super Lolo, Samba a eu la chance d'intégrer le groupe d'Ali Farka Toure pour sa tournée internationale de 1997. A la fin de cette tournée, Samba s'est associé avec Zoumana Tereta, le maître du sokou (le violon malien), son frère Bouri et Djimé Sissoko (le frère de Baba Sissoko) pour mettre au point son propre blues malien.

fields.art_header_en: Soft is the new Creole Soul Folk sensation of 2005 in the French West Indies.
fields.art_header: Soft is the new Creole Soul Folk sensation of 2005 in the french West Indies.
fields.art_biography_fr: L'histoire commence par une amitié entre la guitare et la percussion qui décident de rechercher ensemble une cadence sensible et un son authentique. Très vite, viendra la contrebasse, ronflante, imposante, puis le saxophone d'une expérience riche de jazz, de gospel et de variétés.
fields.art_notes: Mise en ligne page mondomix: 14/06/2006 ----- Mise en ligne page mondomix: 14/06/2006 (français le 28/07/2006)
fields.art_biography:
Soft is the magic encounter of Fred Deshayes's accoustic guitar and vocals, Didier Juste's percussions, Joël  Larochelle's bass and Philip Sadikalay's saxophone.
Inspired by their local creole roots, Soft 's repertoire offers a modern blend of Zouk, Jazz, Folk and Soul music.
Soft is the new Creole Soul Folk sensation of 2005 in the french West Indies.
fields.art_header_fr:
Révélation musicale antillaise 2005, Soft offre un mariage subtil et épicé de quatre instruments :
percussion, contrebasse, guitare, saxophone.
fields.art_biography_en:
Soft is the encounter of Fred Deshayes's accoustic guitar and vocals, Didier Juste's percussion, Joël Larochelle's bass and Philip Sadikalay's saxophone.
Inspired by their local creole roots, Soft 's repertoire offers a modern blend of Zouk, Jazz, Folk and Soul music.
fields.art_keywords: soft, Creole, Soul, Folk, french West Indies, antilles,martinique,guadeloupe

fields.art_header_en: On New Zealand Moana Maniapoto has been a star for quite a while already. She defends the maori people's rights with her music.
fields.art_header_fr: Dans sa Nouvelle-Zélande natale, Moana Maniapoto est déjà une star depuis fort longtemps. Elle défend les droits du peuple maori par la musique.

fields.art_header_en: Paulo Padilha became known as the bass player of the instrumental group Aquilo Del Nisso. On his solo albums Cara Legal and Certeza, Paulo Padilha showcases his work as a composer, arranger, instrumentalist, and singer praised by musicians like Ná Ozzetti, Chico César and Jorge Benjor.
fields.art_header_fr: Paulo Padilha, compositeur, arrangeur, instrumentiste et chanteur a commencé sa carrière en tant que bassiste du groupe instrumental Aquilo Del Nisso. Son talent est reconnu par de nombreux musiciens d'envergure, entre autres  Ná Ozzetti, Chico César et Jorge Benjor.
fields.art_biography_en: Paulo Padilha became known to the public as the bass player of the instrumental group Aquilo Del Nisso. In his solo work, the albums Cara Legal (1997/Velas) and Certeza (2001/Dabliú), Paulo Padilha shows his work as a composer, arranger, instrumentalist and singer praised by renowned musicians like Ná Ozzetti, Chico César and Jorge Benjor.  Graduated in music composition by ECA/USP, he started to play the acoustic guitar when he was 10. He studied composition with Gilberto Mendes and Willy Correia de Oliveira; and the electrical bass with Rodolfo Stroeter (Pau Brasil) and Gerson Frutuoso. As a bass player, he accompanied artists such as Chico César and Suzana Salles.  In 1989 he participated of the Free Jazz Festival with Aquilo Del Nisso and, in 1991, he was nominated to the Apetesp Award for the sound track of the play "Uma Rapsódia de Personagens Extravagantes" (A Rhapsody of Extravagant Characters). Between 1997 and 2001 he participated in many festivals, being always among the first places and receiving the prize for best arrangement in many occasions.  The song Cara Legal was one of the hits of Rádio Musical FM, São Paulo, according to the ranking of songs published by the newspaper Folha da Tarde (4/03/97). The song was included in the anthology A Gema Do Novo 2, released in May 1998, which included the Best New Artists of Musical FM in 1997.  In October 2001, the critic Mauricio Kubrusly wrote the following about the album Certeza in the Chiques e Famosos magazine: "the radios should be playing, at least, A Fome, Juçara and Cachorro. The album has swing ...Jorge Benjor recognizes in Paulo the kind of swing that reminds him of his style. Benjor must be very flattered. To sound like Paulo Padilha could only be a compliment."

fields.art_header_en: An ensemble composed of fifteen musicians that combines all musical genres :  jazz, folk,  tango,  classical, contemporary ...
fields.art_header_fr: Une formation composée d'une quinzaine de musiciens qui s'aventure dans tous les genres musicaux : le jazz, le folk, le tango, le classique contemporain, ... sans jamais trop se prendre au sérieux.

fields.art_header_en: Topic Records is the oldest independent record label in the United Kingdom. May be the oldes independent record label in the world ! From its very first release in 1939 and its origins in the Workers' Music Association through the folk revival to the present day, Topic has mostly focused on English folk music and given a voice to the people.
fields.art_header_fr: Topic Records est le plus vieux label indépendant de Grande-Bretagne. Et peut-être le plus vieux label indépendant du monde ! Depuis ses débuts en 1939, alors qu'il était lié à la Workers' Music Association, Topic s'est essentiellement consacré à diffuser la musique folk anglaise et à donner une voix au peuple du Royaume-Uni.
fields.art_alias: Martin Simpson#Eliza Carthy#John Tams#June Tabor#Martin Carthy#Cilla Fisher#Dick Gaughan#Nic Jones#Jackie Daly#Anne Briggs#Shirley Collins#The Watersons#Davy Graham#Tom Willett#Ray Fisher#Jesse Fuller#Ewan MacColl#Joe Heaney#Scan Tester#Louie Fuller#Paddy Ryan#topic

fields.art_header_en: Born in 1955, Jacob Desvarieux can be considered an inventor of  zouk. At least he articulated this rhythm in the end of the seventies as a member of the band Kassav'. Since then his guitar technique and his astonishing voice became widely recognizable and heard in various musical projects.
fields.art_header_fr: Né en 1955, Jacob Desvarieux peut être considéré comme l'inventeur du zouk. Il en a en tout cas mis au point la rythmique à la fin des années 70 au sein du groupe Kassav'. Depuis, sa voix et ses traits de guitare immédiatement reconnaissables ont été entendus dans des projets de tous genres.

fields.art_header_en: N'Faly Kouyaté is from one of the most famous families of Guinean griots. After a brilliant performance in London opening for Salif Keïta, he was invited to join the group Afro Celt Sound System, with whom he recorded many discs. Faly created a group - Dunyakan (which means "the voice of the people") - in 1996.
fields.art_header_fr: N'Faly Kouyaté est issu de l'une des plus célèbres familles de griots de Guinée. Après une brillante prestation à Londres en première partie de Salif Keïta, il a été invité à rejoindre le groupe Afro Celt Sound System, avec il a enregistré plusieurs disques. Faly a créé le groupe Dunyakan ( qui signifie " la voix du monde " ) en 1996.

fields.art_header_en: Fawzy Al-Aiedy is an Iraqi singer who has been living in Paris for over 25 years. He sings of the Orient, but an Orient where the modern world emerges under the scents of roses and the embroidery of the lute.
fields.art_header_fr: Chanteur irakien installé à Paris depuis plus de 25 ans, Fawzy Al-Aiedy chante l'Orient, mais un Orient où le monde moderne affleure sous les senteurs de roses et les broderies de luth.

fields.art_header_en: Presented as the " Tuareg opposition music", this album brings together a dozen of artists from the desert.Featuring Tinariwen or Terakaft, etc..
fields.art_header_fr: Sous-titrée "musique touarègue de résistance", cette compilation présente une dizaine de groupes de musiciens du désert. Si certains sont déjà très connus (Tinariwen, Terakaft), les autres méritent d'être découverts.
fields.art_alias: Terakaft#Tinariwen #Hasso Akotey#Hamid Ekawel#Mohamed Ag Itlal#Omar Moctar#Etran Finatawa#Koudede#Tamikrest#Toumast

fields.art_header_en: Behind the name 'Azawad' are three original members of the Tinariwen collective: Abdallah, Hassan, and Kedou but also a region between Mali and Niger. Azawad was these musicians' first band.
fields.art_header_fr: Derrière le nom de Azawad se cache, non seulement une région située entre le Mali et le Niger mais aussi les trois membres du collectif Tinariwen : Abdallah, Hassan and Kedou. Ils nous présentent les musiques touaregs, reflet du brassage culturel présent dans cette région.

fields.art_header_en: Born in 1946 in Mhondoro (Zimbabwe), Stella Chiweshe is the first female and one of the most famous mbira (the thumb piano of the Shonas people) player.
fields.art_header_fr: Stella Chiweshe est une musicienne née en 1946 à Mhondoro, au Zimbabwe. Elle est l'une des représentantes les plus célèbres de l'art de jouer de la mbira, le "piano à pouces" traditionnel des Shonas.

fields.art_header_en: This atypical band owes its name to the abandoned textile factory where it gathered together for the first time. Flemish, Walloon and French musicians gathered to work on a theater play. The harmony among them was so uniting that they never parted since.
fields.art_header_fr: Cette fanfare atypique doit son nom à l'usine textile désaffectée dans laquelle elle s'est réunie pour la première fois, la Vetex. Des musiciens flamands, wallons et français s'y étaient retrouvés pour travailler sur la musique d'une pièce de théâtre destinée aux gens du quartier. L'entente a été si cordiale que ces musiciens ne se sont plus quittés ...

fields.art_header_en: Adjabel is a name composed of the Beninese land of Adja and the Haitian goddess of love, Label. It is a name invented by Atissou Loko who composes music that is culturally diverse, free, eclectic and contemporary.
fields.art_header: Abadjel is a particular duo: the Mariame Kadi voice and the haitian drums of Atissou Loko. Together, they wrote some strong texts and make their Vaudou music really put a spell on the auditor.
fields.art_biography_fr:
Adjabel, nom qui fusionne la terre béninoise d'Adja et Label, la déesse haïtienne de l'amour. Un nom inventé par Cyril Forman qui compose une musique libre, métissée, éclectique et contemporaine.
Son instrument, le tambour, celui qu'il a étudié en Haïti, pays d'origine de sa mère. Il en
revient, sous l´alias d´Atissou Loko, instruit du savoir-faire des anciens d´une terre où le roi tambour puise sa tradition dans le berceau africain et passe par le mouvement Sanba.
Les influences d'Atissou Loko n´étant pas restrictives, il marie savoureusement les rythmes d'Afrique et de la Caraïbe, selon la formation d'Adjabel, à la chanson française, au jazz, à la world, ainsi ont été élaborés les trois premiers albums Racine 1, 2 et 3 qui ont donné lieu à plus d'une centaine de concerts.

Le percussionniste, maître des tambours ancestraux, s'entoure de musiciens enragés, Peter Corser aux saxophones, clarinette et lambis, Jackson Thélémaque à la guitare, Gillian Mombo aux seconds tambours et Kata. Ces quatre membres constituent le noyau dur d'un groupe à géométrie variable, car Adjabel est ouvert à toutes les collaborations et trouve son élan dans le "live" de manière très spontanée.
Leur énergie embarque le public qui participe volontiers, on danse, on tape des mains, on rit.
Adjabel a l'expérience de la scène, le groupe tourne régulièrement sur plusieurs salles
parisiennes (Le Satellit', L'Olympic, l'Entrepôt, la Guinguette Pirate...)mais il aime aussi le contact direct d'une foule parisienne peu disponible, souvent pressée : les passants du métro.
Le secret d'Adjabel est là, aller toujours à la rencontre de nouveaux visages. Chaque semaine, métro Châtelet, sortie place Sainte Opportune, Adjabel fait mouche, l'ambiance est bien là, les spectateurs conquis repartent avec une énergie qu´ils ne s´attendaient pas à trouver dans le métro.
Cette musique généreuse n'oublie pas ceux qui luttent pour donner un sens à leur vie, Adjabel entame aussi une tournée des hôpitaux de la capitale.
Un engagement qui peut sembler anodin, couronné d'un succès dont vous n'entendrez pas parler mais qui procure au groupe, ainsi qu'à ce public en marge, le plaisir instinctif de communiquer librement en se divertissant.
fields.art_notes: Fiche artiste mondomix créée le 23/06/2006Fiche artiste mondomix créée le 23/06/2006
fields.art_biography:
In 2000, Adjabel release its first record "Tanbou base music". Adjabel come from "Adja" which is a land in Benin where a vaudou culture exist and "Label" which is a love goddess of Haïti. Mariame Kadi and Atissou Loko met a few years before in 1997. At these times, Mariame Kadi is an autdidact who plays guitar and sing her own song, Cyril Forman has just taken the name of Atissou Loko,  and is starting a band influenced by his stay in Haïti, the land of his ancestors where his interest for the Vaudou culture had really grown. 
Mariame Kadi and Atissou Loko are both involved in the song writting and if the group have a strong identity, each of them bring his own sensibility and style to the lyrics. Text are very important in the Adjabel music which could be seen as an evolution of classical french song. But it's the ambiance, the voice and the involvment of Adjabel who make this band a Paris happy few secret.
Two another release will follow "Tanbou base music" (Racine 1) to complete a kind of trilogy: "Akoustic Resolution", racine 2 in 2001 and "Origines" or Racine 3 in 2004.
fields.art_header_fr: Adjabel, nom qui fusionne la terre béninoise d'Adja et Label, la déesse haïtienne de l'amour. Un nom inventé par Atissou Loko qui compose une musique libre, métissée, éclectique et contemporaine.
fields.art_biography_en:
Adjabel is a name composed of the Beninese land of Adja and the Haitian goddess of love, Label. It is a name invented by Cyril Forman who composes music that is culturally diverse, free, eclectic and contemporary.
His instrument is the tambour, which he studied in his mother's country of Haiti.
He came back as alias Atissou Loko, having been instructed in the knowledge of his ancestors, from a land where the tambour king draws its tradition from the cradle of
Africa and the Sanba movement.
Not being restrictive, Atissou's influences deliciously mix African and Caribbean influences with French songs, jazz, world music and rap, according to who is in the group at the time. This eclectic mix produced the albums Racine 1,2 and 3, which gave rise to more than a hundred concerts.
The percussionist surrounds himself with fired up musicians : Peter Corser on saxophones, clarinet and conches, Jackson Télémaque on guitar, Gillian Mombo on Second tambours and Kata and sound engineer and effects, Hugo Richard.
These five members constitute the core of a group that is geometrically changeable, because Adjabel is open to all kinds of collaborations. It finds its momentum in the "live", in a spontaneous fashion. Their energy launches the audience voluntarily towards dancing, clapping and laughter.
Adjabel has a lot of stage experience. The group plays regularly in several Parisian venues, but they also enjoy the often-stressed Parisian crowds in the subway. Adjabel's secret is there: always wanting to meet new faces. Every week, Châtelet subway, Saint Opportune exit, Adjabel can be heard.
The atmosphere is there. The audiences who are won over by the show, continue on their way with an energy that they weren't expecting to find in the subway.
Aware that music is for everybody, including those who are struggling to make sense of their lives, Adjabel has started playing in hospitals in and around the capital, allowing the residents to play with them, to dance and to laugh. This success may go unnoticed in the press, but the group considers it to be the most valuable aspect of their work.

fields.art_header_en: Nayima Alal is a new hope of Saharan music. Poet and musician, born in a family where poetry and music seem as ordinary as cooking and sewing, he plays guitar, accordion and percussion.
fields.art_header_fr: Nayim Alal est l'un des nouveaux espoirs de la musique sahraouie. Poète et musicien, né au sein d'une famille où la poésie et la musique semblent aussi ordinaires que la cuisine et la couture, il joue de la guitare, de l'accordéon et des percussions.

fields.art_header_en: Born in Yaounde, Cameroon in 1974, Blick Bassy's music is influenced by both by his upbringing by his grandparents in rural Cameroon and by his love for soul and jazz.  Sung in French, Bassa and English, Bassy's work reflects the enduring beauty of Africa and its musical traditions.
fields.art_header_fr: Blick Bassy est né en 1974, à Yaoundé, la capitale du Cameroun, mais à grandi à Mintaba, auprès de ses grands-parents. Il y a pris conscience de la beauté de ses racines et de la langue bassa, celle qu'il préserve aujourd'hui à travers ses chansons.

fields.art_header_en:
Ruth Yaakov was born in Israel and received her musical education at the Rubin Academy of Music in Tel Aviv. With a repertoire drawing from opera, folk-song and Sephardic chamber-music, she has performed on many famous stages all over the world. Violinist and accordionist Shkelzen Doli was born in Albania, later moved to Kosovo and went on to study music in Novi Sad, Sarajevo and finally Vienna where, since 1995, he has been a member of the Vienna Symphony Orchestra.
Saz, oud and bouzouki player Juan Carlos Sungurlian was born in Uruguay. His family originally came from Turkey. He studied music in Uruguay and Argentina, where he also played Armenian, Greek, Turkish and Arabian music. Percussionist Levent Tarhan was born in Turkey. He plays in a wide variety of musical projects and is a composer of music for the theatre.
fields.art_header_fr:
Ruth Yaakov est née en Israël et a reçu son éducation musicale à la "Rubin Academy of Music" à Tel Aviv. Avec un répertoire qui comprend aussi bien de l'opéra, que de la folk ou de la musique de chambre sépharade, elle a donné des représentations sur les scènes mondiales les plus connues.
Le violoniste et accordéoniste Shkelzen Doli est né en Albanie puis a déménagé au Kosovo pour finalement habiter à Vienne, où il fait partie de l'orchestre symphonique.
Juan Carlos Sungurlian,le joueur de saz, oud et de bouzouki vient d'Uruguay. Il est d'abord passé par l'Argentine pour jouer de la musique arménienne, grecque, arabe et turque.
Enfin, le percussionniste Levent Tarhan est né en Turquie. Il prend part à de nombreux projets musicaux et compose aussi de la musique pour le théâtre.

fields.art_header_en: Rokia Traoré is one of the greatest contemporary voices in Africa today. Deeply rooted in her African tradition, and yet looking at the world in a very modern way, her music is the artistic expression of her multiculturalism. Rokia Traoré is an accomplished composer and arranger as well as a poetic, sensitive, enlightened lyricist. Her songs pay homage to her country, speak of her vision for the future and invite those who listen to share in her experiences as a young and profoundly modern African artist.
fields.art_header: Rokia Traoré is one of the greatest voices in all of Africa today.
fields.art_biography_fr: Laureate du concours Découvertes RFl Afrique 1997 et, la même année, révélation du festival Musiques Métisses d'Angoulême, Rokia Traoré, vingt-sept ans, incarne cette nouvelle génération d'artistes qui demeure attachée à ses racines africaines tout en portant un regard moderne sur le monde. La nouvelle égérie malienne, également auteur-compositeur de talent, fait fi des clichés habituellement infligés à la musique africaine.
fields.art_biography:
Rokia Traoré is only twenty-seven years old and is already recognized as one of the greatest voices in all of Africa today. She comes to us from Mali, from Bamako, without the slightest doubt in her mind, as her talent is backed up by strength and serenity. Full of freshness and nerve, and with natural authority and great integrity in her artistic choices, she has already charmed many of the most influential musicians on the African continent. A handsome calling card for this young singer at a time when she is about to step up onto international stages.
Already a winner of the "RFI Discoveries - Africa 1997" and a revelation at the "Musiques Métisses of Angoulême", Rokia Traoré creates a deliciously original and appealing music that is resolutely based on tradition and opens up onto a tempered modernity that never makes any sacrifices to the "merging" trends of Western World Music. If Rokia Traoré innovates and imposes an already singular voice in contemporary African music, it is as a responsible artist aware of the forms she wishes to be part of. A music that dares new and exciting instrumental melting pot by inventing orchestral colors that depict with sweet nostalgia the mischievous compositions of the singer.
fields.art_header_fr: Rokia Traoré est l'une des plus grandes voix contemporaines de l'Afrique. Profondément ancrée dans la tradition africaine tout en portant un regard résolument moderne sur le monde, sa musique est l'expression artistique de son multiculturalisme. Rokia Traoré est une compositrice et arrangeuse accomplie. Ses chansons rendent hommage à son pays.

Full of freshness and nerve, and with natural authority and great integrity in her artistic choices, she has already charmed many of the most influential musicians on the African continent. A handsome calling card for this young singer at a time when she is about to step up onto international stages.
Already a winner of the "RFI Discoveries - Africa 1997" and a revelation at the "Musiques Métisses of Angoulême", Rokia Traoré creates a deliciously original and appealing music that is resolutely based on tradition and opens up onto a tempered modernity that never makes any sacrifices to the "merging" trends of Western World Music. fields.art_header_en: Kristin Asbjørnsen is a Norwegian singer who has made herself known by composing the original soundtrack of a film inspired by a Charles Bukowski novel, "Factotum". Her work is inspired by African American gospel, as well as by jazz, traditional music and African music.
fields.art_header_fr: Kristin Asbjørnsen est une chanteuse norvégienne qui s'est fait connaître en composant la bande-originale d'un film inspiré d'un roman de Charles Bukowski, "Factotum". Son travail s'inspire du gospel afro-américain, autant que du jazz, des musiques traditionnelles ou des musiques africaines.

fields.art_header_en: Finley Quaye is a British reggae singer. His grandfather was a pianist born in Accra, Ghana, his father, Cab Kaye, a Jazz musician living in the United Kingdom. Additionally, Duke Ellington was Finley's Godfather. In 1997, Finley released his first album, "Maverick A Strike" and reached the UK Top 20 twice with "Sunday Shining", and "Even After All". Two more albums were released: "Vanguard" (2000) and "Much More Than Much Love" (2004).
fields.art_header_fr: Finley Quaye est un chanteur de reggae anglais. Son grand-père était un pianiste né à Accra, au Ghana. Son père, Cab Kaye, était un musicien de jazz installé en Grande-Bretagne. Duke Ellington était son parrain. En 1997, Finley Quaye a sorti son premier album, "Maverick a strike", et a tout de suite imposé ses titres ("Sunday shining", "Even after all") dans le Top 20 anglais. Deux autres albums ont suivi : "Vanguard" (2000) et "Much more than much love" (2004 ).

fields.art_header_en: Burundi is part of this great cultural zone known as the "Great Lakes Region" and yet his music differs considerably from that of its neighbors, Rwanda and Tanzania.
fields.art_header_fr: Le Burundi fait partie de cette grande zone culturelle que l'on appelle la "Région des grands lacs" et pourtant sa musique diffère considérablement de celle de ses voisins, le Rwanda ou la Tanzanie.

fields.art_header_en: La Troba Kung-Fu is a new band of  Joan Garriga, singer and accordionist of the famous Catalan band Dusminguet. The diversity of influences that charactarized Dusminguet is present in this new band that proudly claims to play  "rumba-dub-reggae-cumbia-paseo-rock-vallenato".
fields.art_header_fr: La Troba Kung-Fu est le nouveau groupe de Joan Garriga, le chanteur-accordéoniste du légendaire groupe catalan Dusminguet. La diversité d'influences qui caractérisait déjà Dusminguet s'accentue encore avec ce nouveau groupe qui proclame fièrement jouer de la "rumba-dub-reggae-cumbia-paseo-rock-vallenato".

fields.art_header_en: Series of compilations coordinated by Damien Chemin and intended to introduce to the rest of the world the Brazilian musicians who play forro, a dancing rhythm of the "Nordeste".
fields.art_header_fr: Série de compilations coordonnée par Damien Chemin et destinée à faire connaître les musiciens qui pratiquent le forro dans le Nordeste du Brésil. Il s'agit essentiellement d'enregistrements de terrain qui permettent de découvrir le forro à l'état brut, tel qu'on l'entend sur les places des villages et dans les arrières-cours des musiciens.
